name: Michigan Hot Dogs
author: Soup Loving Nicole
summary: Simple hot dogs prepared Michigan style. I like to serve these with dill pickle-flavored potato chips for extra tang but French fries work good too.
ingredients: 8 frankfurter (5 in long x 3/4 in dia, 10 per pound)s hot dogs
2 tablespoons prepared yellow mustard, or to taste
directions: Place hot dogs in a large stockpot
Cover with water and bring to a boil
Turn heat off, cover, and let sit
Heat a skillet over medium-high heat, add ground beef and half of the diced onions
Cook and stir until beef is no longer pink; making sure to break into fine pieces, about 8 minutes
Meanwhile, whisk water, ketchup, tomato paste, vinegar, Worcestershire sauce, and chili powder until smooth
Drain ground beef mixture and return to the skillet
Stir in reserved ketchup mixture, reduce heat, and simmer for 10 minutes
Top hot dogs with beef mixture
Divide remaining onions on top of the beef mixture and garnish with mustard
